base.name: SharpGen
author: Russel Van Tuyl (@Ne0nd0g)

options.name: dotnetbin
options.description: The file path for the "dotnet" core executable. Use just executable name if in PATH variable

options.name: file
options.description: The output file name (not the path)

options.name: dotnet
options.description: The Dotnet Framework version to target (net35 or net40)

options.name: output-kind
options.description: The OutputKind to use (dll or console)

options.name: platform
options.description: The Platform to use (AnyCpy, x86, or x64)

options.name: assembly-name
options.description: The name of the assembly to be generated

options.name: class-name
options.description: The name of the class to be generated

base.description:
SharpGen is a .NET Core console application that utilizes the Rosyln C# compiler to quickly cross-compile .NET Framework console applications or libraries.
	GitHub: https://github.com/cobbr/SharpGen
	Introductory blog post: https://cobbr.io/SharpGen.html
base.notes:
This module is based on Ryan Cobb's SharpGen projects at https://github.com/cobbr/SharpGen.
	.NET core 2.1 must ALREADY be installed on the Merlin server: https://dotnet.microsoft.com/download
